snippet: Two studies have found that Y Chromosome Adam and Mitochondrial Eve, originally thought to have been thousands of years apart, may have lived at the same time in the same region.
abstract: Studies published in journal Science suggest that most recent common male ancestor of Homo sapiens, Y Chromosome Adam, and the most recent common female ancestor, Mitochondrial Eve, may have lived at same time and in approximately same region; it was previously thought that they lived hundreds of thousands of years apart.
lead_paragraph: Two studies have found that Y Chromosome Adam and Mitochondrial Eve, originally thought to have been thousands of years apart, may have lived at the same time in the same region.

headline.print_headline: Evolution: New Studies Suggest an ‘Adam’ and ‘Eve’ Link
headline.main: New Studies Suggest an ‘Adam’ and ‘Eve’ Link
